title: Baby girl dies in hospital as police arrest man, 21, and 19-year-old woman
text:

A 21-year-old man and a 19-year-old woman have been arrested after a baby girl died in hospital.

The one-year-old was found seriously injured at a property in the town of Radcliffe, Greater Manchester on Wednesday afternoon.

The girl was taken to hospital where she died despite the best efforts of specialist doctors, Greater Manchester Police said in a statement.

Superintendent Chris Bridge of GMP’s Wigan District said: “This is a truly devastating incident that has led to a one-year-old girl losing her life.

"Specially trained police officers are with the family and are doing everything they can to support them through this dreadful time.

“A 21-year-old man and a 19-year-old woman have now been arrested and we are working hard to understand what course of events led to the death of an innocent baby girl.”

The man has been arrested on suspicion of murder and the woman has been arrested on suspicion of causing or allowing the death of a child.
description: Greater Manchester Police said a man had been arrested on suspicion of murder after the death of the baby girl found seriously injured in Radcliffe
